intro: Anthospermum aethiopicum var. montanum, commonly known as the mountain anthospermum, is a flowering plant native to regions of Africa and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale yellow. Its leaves are usually opposite, simple, and have a slightly serrated margin. This variant is often found in mountainous or high-altitude habitats, where it thrives in cooler, more humid conditions.
